standard_metadata.standard_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

question.content: The data below represents the number of essays that students in Mr. Ji's class wrote.  $2$, $3$, $5$, $5$, $6$, $7$, $8$, $8$, $11$  **Which box plot correctly summarizes the data?**

images.alt: A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 14, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 4. The box extends from 4 to 8 and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6. The right whisker extends from 8 to 11. All values estimated.

A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 14, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 3. The box extends from 3 to 7 and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6. The right whisker extends from 7 to 11. All values estimated.

A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 14, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 4. The box extends from 4 to 9 and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6. The right whisker extends from 9 to 12. All values estimated.

hints.content: $\begin{align} &\maroonD{\large{2}}, 3, 5, 5, \purpleD{\large6}, 7, 8, 8, \blueE{{\large11}}\\\\ &\text{Min} = \maroonD{2}\\\\ &\text{Median} = \purpleD6\\\\ &\text{Max} = \blueE{11} \end{align}$
$\begin{align} & 2, {\large3},  {\large5}, 5,  \purpleD{6},  7, {\large8},  {\large8}, 11\\\\ & Q_{1} = \dfrac{3 + 5}{2} = 4\\\\ & Q_{3} = \dfrac{8 + 8}{2}= 8 \end{align}$
The following box plot correctly summarizes the data.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 14, in increments of 1. A left whisker, with its end shaded pink, extends from 2 to 4. The box extends from 4 to 8 and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment, shaded purple, at 6. The right whisker extends from 8 to 11, with its right end shaded blue. All values estimated.

question.content: **Which data set could be represented by the box plot shown below?**

images.alt: A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 15, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 4. The box extends from 4 to 8 and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6. The right whisker extends from 8 to 11. All values estimated.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 15, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 4, where 2 is identified as the min. The box extends from 4, identified as Q1, to 8, identified as Q3, and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6, which is identified as the median. The right whisker extends from 8 to 11, where 11 is identified as the max. All values estimated.

hints.content: The minimum of the box plot is $2$.  We can eliminate one of the data sets because it does not have a minimum of $2$.  $ \redE{\large3}$, $3$, $5$, $5$, $6$, $7$, $8$, $9$, $11$
The median of the box plot is $6$.  We can eliminate one of the data sets because it does not have a median of $6$.  $ 2$, $3$, $5$, $5$, $\redE{\large7}$, $7$, $8$, $10$, $11$

The third quartile of the box plot is $8$.  We can eliminate one of the data sets because it does not have a third quartile of $8$.  $ 2$, $3$, $5$, $5$, $6$, $7$, $\redE{\large8}$, $\redE{\large{10}}$, $11$

The following data set  could be represented by the box plot.  $\maroonD{\large{2}}$, ${\large{3}}$, ${\large{5}}$, $5$, $\purpleD{\large{6}}$, $7$, ${\large{8}}$, ${\large{8}}$, $\blueE{\large{11}}$  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A horizontal boxplot is plotted along a horizontal axis marked from 0 to 15, in increments of 1. A left whisker extends from 2 to 4, where 2 is shaded pink and identified as the min. The box extends from 4, identified as Q1, to 8, identified as Q3, and is divided into 2 parts by a vertical line segment at 6, which is shaded purple and identified as the median. The right whisker extends from 8 to 11, where 11 is shaded blue and identified as the max. All values estimated.
